Class ParallelSumThreads

  • java.lang.Object
    • ParallelSumThreads

  • public class ParallelSumThreads
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes creates an array of the size given by the user and takes in the amount of threads that the program will create to compute the sum in parallel using the multiple threads.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParallelSumThreads() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int concurrentSum(int[] randomNumbers, int numOfThreads)
      Calculates the sum of the numbers of the inputted array by dividing the work between the inputted number of threads and them sums them back together and returns the result.
      static int[] createRandomArray(int length)
      Creates an array of inputted size with random numbers between 1 and 10.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main thread in which we take the parameters from the user, call all of the methods and display the total sum and the time it took for both a multithread version and the single thread version.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • ParallelSumThreads

        public ParallelSumThreads()

    • Method Detail

      • createRandomArray

        public static int[] createRandomArray(int length)
        Creates an array of inputted size with random numbers between 1 and 10.
        Parameters:
        length - of Array
        Returns:
        randomNumbers array filled with numbers between 1 and 10

      • concurrentSum

        public static int concurrentSum(int[] randomNumbers,
                                int numOfThreads)
        Calculates the sum of the numbers of the inputted array by dividing the work between the inputted number of threads and them sums them back together and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        randomNumbers - array filled with numbers between 1 and 10
        numOfThreads - number of threads which the method will use
        Returns:
        total of the sum of the numbers in the array

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main thread in which we take the parameters from the user, call all of the methods and display the total sum and the time it took for both a multithread version and the single thread version.
        Parameters:
        args - an array of command-line arguments for the application.
